trans-unit.source: Configure Local Storage Resources
trans-unit.target: Configure Local Storage Resources

trans-unit.source: A local storage resource is a reserved directory in the file system of the virtual machine in which an instance of a role is running.
trans-unit.target: A local storage resource is a reserved directory in the file system of the virtual machine in which an instance of a role is running.

trans-unit.source: You can store information in your virtual machine instance so that code running in the instance can access the local storage resource when it needs to write to or read from a file.
trans-unit.target: You can store information in your virtual machine instance so that code running in the instance can access the local storage resource when it needs to write to or read from a file.

trans-unit.source: For example, a local storage resource can be used to cache data that may need to be accessed again while the service is running in Azure.
trans-unit.target: For example, a local storage resource can be used to cache data that may need to be accessed again while the service is running in Azure.

trans-unit.source: You can also configure local storage resource to store files during startup.
trans-unit.target: You can also configure local storage resource to store files during startup.

trans-unit.source: For more information on configuring local storage resources for startup, see [Using Local Storage to Store Files During Startup](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh974419.aspx)
trans-unit.target: For more information on configuring local storage resources for startup, see [Using Local Storage to Store Files During Startup](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh974419.aspx)

trans-unit.source: A local storage resource is declared in the service definition file.
trans-unit.target: A local storage resource is declared in the service definition file.

trans-unit.source: You can declare any number of local storage resources for a role.
trans-unit.target: You can declare any number of local storage resources for a role.

trans-unit.source: Each local storage resource is reserved for every instance of that role.
trans-unit.target: Each local storage resource is reserved for every instance of that role.

trans-unit.source: The minimum amount of disk space that you can allocate for a local storage resource is 1 MB.
trans-unit.target: The minimum amount of disk space that you can allocate for a local storage resource is 1 MB.

trans-unit.source: The maximum amount that you can allocate for any given local resource depends on the size of the virtual machine that is specified for the role.
trans-unit.target: The maximum amount that you can allocate for any given local resource depends on the size of the virtual machine that is specified for the role.

trans-unit.source: Each virtual machine size has a corresponding total storage allocation, and the total space allocated for all local storage resources declared for a role cannot exceed the maximum size allotted for that virtual machine size.
trans-unit.target: Each virtual machine size has a corresponding total storage allocation, and the total space allocated for all local storage resources declared for a role cannot exceed the maximum size allotted for that virtual machine size.

trans-unit.source: For more information about the maximum amount of local disk space that is allotted for each virtual machine size, see [Configure Sizes for Cloud Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee814754.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information about the maximum amount of local disk space that is allotted for each virtual machine size, see [Configure Sizes for Cloud Services](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ee814754.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Be aware that it is the developer's responsibility to ensure that the amount of disk space that is requested for a local storage resource does not exceed the maximum amount allotted for a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Be aware that it is the developer's responsibility to ensure that the amount of disk space that is requested for a local storage resource does not exceed the maximum amount allotted for a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: If you configure a local storage resource to be larger than the allowed maximum, an error will not occur until you attempt a write operation that exceeds the allowed maximum.
trans-unit.target: If you configure a local storage resource to be larger than the allowed maximum, an error will not occur until you attempt a write operation that exceeds the allowed maximum.

trans-unit.source: In that case, the write operation will fail and an out of disk space error message will appear.
trans-unit.target: In that case, the write operation will fail and an out of disk space error message will appear.

trans-unit.source: The processing model for Azure is try/fail.
trans-unit.target: The processing model for Azure is try/fail.

trans-unit.source: If you receive an out of disk space error you can handle the error and clear some disk space.
trans-unit.target: If you receive an out of disk space error you can handle the error and clear some disk space.

trans-unit.source: You can then retry the write operation.
trans-unit.target: You can then retry the write operation.

trans-unit.source: You can specify that a local storage resource be preserved when an instance is recycled.
trans-unit.target: You can specify that a local storage resource be preserved when an instance is recycled.

trans-unit.source: However, data that is saved to the local file system of the virtual machine is not guaranteed to be durable.
trans-unit.target: However, data that is saved to the local file system of the virtual machine is not guaranteed to be durable.

trans-unit.source: If your role requires durable data, it is recommended that you use a Azure drive to store file data.
trans-unit.target: If your role requires durable data, it is recommended that you use a Azure drive to store file data.

trans-unit.source: Azure drives are backed by the Azure Blob service, so they are guaranteed to be durable.
trans-unit.target: Azure drives are backed by the Azure Blob service, so they are guaranteed to be durable.

trans-unit.target: Adding a local storage resource

trans-unit.source: To declare a local storage resource within the service definition file, add the **LocalResources** element as a child of a **WebRole** element or the **WorkerRole** element.
trans-unit.target: To declare a local storage resource within the service definition file, add the **LocalResources** element as a child of a **WebRole** element or the **WorkerRole** element.

trans-unit.source: Then add a **LocalStorage** element to represent the resource.
trans-unit.target: Then add a **LocalStorage** element to represent the resource.

trans-unit.source: The **LocalStorage** element takes three attributes:
trans-unit.target: The **LocalStorage** element takes three attributes:

trans-unit.source: name
trans-unit.target: name

trans-unit.source: *sizeInMB*: Specifies the desired size for this local storage resource
trans-unit.target: *sizeInMB*: Specifies the desired size for this local storage resource

trans-unit.source: *cleanOnRoleRecycle*: Specifies whether the local storage resource should be wiped clean when a role instance is recycled, or whether it should be persisted across the role life cycle.
trans-unit.target: *cleanOnRoleRecycle*: Specifies whether the local storage resource should be wiped clean when a role instance is recycled, or whether it should be persisted across the role life cycle.

trans-unit.source: The default value is **true**.
trans-unit.target: The default value is **true**.

trans-unit.source: Because the **LocalResource** object represents a directory, you can read from it and write to it by using the standard .NET file I/O classes.
